programme.title: Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: Turnage was born a slave; he has made multiple escape attempts, and has been brutally beaten because of them.

programme.title: Bessie Coleman: Queen of the Skies
programme.desc: Widely regarded as the first woman of African American descent to have a pilot's license, Bessie Coleman soars across the sky.

programme.desc: Dr. John Doy is a guide on the Underground Railroad attempting to lead a group of men, women, and children to safety in Canada.

programme.title: Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: Colonel Thomas Rose is one of more than 1000 officers held in the notorious Libby Prison of Richmond, Va., known for its stark white walls, numbing conditions and rats.

programme.title: Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.sub-title: Pauline Cushman: Tales of a Yankee Spy

programme.title: Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: The frontlines of the Civil War lie hundreds of miles from Vermont, but Confederate Bennett Young plans to bring the war to the North; he leads a group of raiders into the town of St. Albans to rob its banks and burn its buildings.

programme.title: Inside the Mind of a Con Artist
programme.desc: Christophe Rocancourt is a French impostor and con artist who scammed rich and powerful people by masquerading in turn as a French nobleman, the heir to the Rockefeller family, or as a Russian prince.

programme.title: Inside the Mind of a Con Artist
programme.desc: Matthew Cox is a former mortgage broker from Florida who found himself on the Secret Service's most wanted list; he made millions falsifying home ownership and mortgage documents for five times the properties' actual worth.

programme.title: Inside the Mind of a Con Artist
programme.desc: Jan Lewan is the polka sensation from Pennsylvania who fleeced millions of investors with his classic Ponzi scheme; his name shot to fame when Netflix produced the movie "Polka King" with actor Jack Black playing Jan Lewan.

programme.title: Inside the Mind of a Con Artist
programme.desc: Nicknamed The Chameleon, Frédéric Bourdin is a former French serial imposter who claims to have faked at least five hundred false identities, including a young Texas boy who went missing in the mid-90s.

programme.title: Inside the Mind of a Con Artist
programme.desc: Shaun Greenhalgh is a British artist and art forger; between 1989 and 2006, he produced a number of forgeries including Roman and Chinese art objects, and medieval Christian relics, that fooled some of the world's most respected art institutions.

programme.title: Inside the Mind of a Con Artist
programme.desc: Dubbed the "Mini Madoff," Kiener is one of Germany's greatest con artists, tricking thousands of private investors and banks, including Barclays and JP Morgan, to the tune of more than $300 million.

programme.title: Blindspots
programme.desc: James and his sister Cassie visit Frankfurt and Mainz, enjoying beer and brats, and exploring Germany's infrastructure of support for the visually impaired; this culminates in a tour of the Dialogue Museum.

programme.title: Blindspots
programme.desc: James and his sister Cassie travel to Zurich and visit ETH Zurich, the MIT of Europe, where they try out prototypes of new technological solutions for accessibility; they venture to the top of a tall peak in Davos for an evening in an igloo.

programme.title: Access All Areas
programme.desc: Francesca Chiorando dives into life in Cornwall to discover the ancient practices of witchcraft and smuggling.

programme.title: Access All Areas
programme.desc: Francesca Chiorando is on a quest to discover the truth behind the city of Naples, to see if it is a kingdom of violence and a culture obsessed with death.

programme.title: Bright Now!
programme.desc: The forgotten ships that made possible the liberation of France during World War II.

programme.title: Bright Now!
programme.desc: Explaining how weather forecasts have become so reliable with advancing technologies.

programme.title: Bright Now!
programme.desc: Examining human survival mechanisms that modern science is only beginning to understand.

programme.title: Bright Now!
programme.desc: The Hadzabe of Tanzania, considered one of the last hunter-gather tribes on the planet, pass the knowledge of this way of life to the next generation.

programme.title: Bright Now!
programme.desc: Scientists and citizens armed with cutting-edge technology battle swarms of locusts devouring everything in their path from Africa to India.

programme.title: Bright Now!
programme.desc: A look at the tiny insects with incredible capabilities that are locked in a struggle to survive in the surface film of most lakes and ponds.

programme.title: Blindspots
programme.desc: Escaping the hustle and bustle of the big city, James takes the train to visit the rest of England; from ghost tours and hiking in Scotland, to football in Liverpool, to an epic thrill ride in Wales.

programme.title: Blindspots
programme.desc: James and his older brother Colton head to Austin, Texas to sample BBQ from a blind pitmaster and live music from a blind musician; ashort road trip to Houston connects them with blind celebrity chef Christine Ha.

programme.title: Titans: The Rise of Hollywood
programme.desc: At the dawn of the 20th Century, immigrant entrepreneur Carl Laemmle looks to cash in on America's growing fascination with moving pictures; but as he starts to build an industry, he comes up against a powerful cartel headed by Thomas Edison.

programme.title: Titans: The Rise of Hollywood
programme.desc: Edison's stranglehold on the moving picture industry forces Laemmle and his band of renegade filmmakers to flee to Cuba, but not before he signs a promising young actress named Mary Pickford.

programme.title: Titans: The Rise of Hollywood
programme.desc: To outdo his rivals, Laemmle builds a massive film factory in Hollywood called Universal City.

programme.title: Titans: The Rise of Hollywood
programme.desc: As Hollywood goes from a dusty farm town to a bustling metropolis, the balance of power shifts in favor of the stars; titans like Paramount's Zukor are now forced to pay huge contracts to top actors to keep them happy.

programme.title: Titans: The Rise of Hollywood
programme.desc: By 1925, Zukor's Paramount Pictures, Laemmle's Universal Pictures, and Mayer's MGM are some of the most profitable businesses in the country.

programme.title: Titans: The Rise of Hollywood
programme.desc: The Warners' film "The Jazz Singer" proves to the world that "talkies" are here to stay.
